post: The Bill of Rights Institute would like to thank Star Spangled Tea for their generous donation of teas at our 'Tea Party' last weekend at  #NCSS2024. Teachers who attended the breakfast enjoyed the brewed Georgia Peach Apricot Black Tea & basket giveaway. Star Spangled Tea specializes in an assortment of artisanal teas expertly sourced and regionally inspired by the great U. S. A. Interested in purchasing? When you shop using code 'BRI1791,' a portion of your purchase goes back to BRI. Visit  https://lnkd.in/eNRSQW2C to shop.  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #StarSpangledTea  #tea

Did you know that the majority of our team at ActivateGenZ, including our Executive Director (and Founder!),Sam Underhill, and Editor-in-Chief, Cecelia Cullen, are proud alumni of the Bill of Rights Institute's Student Fellowship Program? 💡 The BRI fellowship was more than just an opportunity to explore civic engagement; it was a transformative experience that empowered us to lead, think critically, and make a tangible impact. The lessons we learnedabout leadership, constitutional principles, and the power of youth voicesare at the very core of what drives ActivateGenZ's mission today. To the Bill of Rights Internship, thank you for believing in us, inspiring us, and continuing to support the next generation of changemakers.

The Bill of Rights Institute was founded on the simple, powerful belief that all students should have access to a high-quality education in civics and history. 2024 marks the 25th anniversary of the founding of the Bill of Rights Institute. Read the article to see how BRI is celebrating a quarter-century of supporting educators and students in every corner of America.  #billofrightsinstitute  #BRI  #anniversary  #civicseducation

We would like to thank BNP Empowered Print and Quality Bindery Services, Inc. for their generous donation to the Bill of Rights Institute. Thousands of students in New York will now have pocket constitutions thanks to BNP and Quality Bindery Services. BNP Empowered Print is a full-service printing company based in Buffalo, NY, specializing in turn-key print solutions such as digital, web offset, and other printing capabilities. To learn more, visit  https://printbnp.com/ Quality Bindery Services Inc. is a comprehensive hardcover and softcover bookbinding shop for materials new and old. QBS is a full-service post-press finishing bindery for printers in Buffalo & Rochester, NY and Erie, PA. Learn more at  https://lnkd.in/eMU9KKnt Interested in donating? Visit  https://lnkd.in/eK6jcJau.

Calling all patriotic tea drinkers! The Bill of Rights Institute is proud to partner with companies like Star Spangled Tea. Star Spangled Tea offers signature American tea blends from a veteran-owned business. Specializing in an assortment of artisanal teas expertly sourced and regionally inspired by the great U. S. A. Interested in purchasing your favorite tea? Visit  https://lnkd.in/eNRSQW2C and use code ‘BRI1791' at checkout.  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #StarSpangledTea  #Tea

The Bill of Rights Institute would like to thank the Texas Bar Foundation for its generous support to advance civic education. Since its inception in 1965, the Texas Bar Foundation has awarded more than $28 million in grants to law-related programs. Supported by members of the State Bar of Texas, the Texas Bar Foundation is the nation's largest charitably-funded bar foundation. The Texas Bar Foundations generous $10,000 grant will support the Bill of Rights Institutes professional development programs in Texas, where the Institute currently works with more than 7,000 civics and history teachers. To read more, visit  https://lnkd.in/g-4zsHQs  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #texasbarfoundation

GIVE HAPPY so students across the country can continue to improve their communities with programs like MyImpact Challenge. Are you a Federal employee or retiree? Then GIVE HAPPY to the Bill of Rights Institute through the Combined Federal Campaign using charity code 36265. MyImpact Challenge is a civic engagement contest supported by BRI to create a robust understanding of citizenship and incentivize students to become active in their communities now! One of the great benefits of the CFC is that you can give through payroll deduction or your retiree annuity, giving a little each pay period and supporting BRI's mission all year long.  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #GIVECFC

Give the gift of COMMUNITY by supporting Community Improvement. Your $750 donation installs a solar powered well to bring clean, safe water to a community without a sanitary water source. Let's spread happiness together. Give today at U. S. Office of Personnel Management (OPM)s GiveCFC.org.  #GiveCFC

You're Invited! 2024 marks the 25th anniversary of the Bill of Rights Institute. Join us for a cocktail reception on December 5, 2024, from 6-8pm! With words from BRI leadership, including Vice President of Development Anthony Simone and Vice President of Civic Leadership Development Gerald Gangaram. RSVP Here:  https://lnkd.in/eJ3KPi7a  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #Anniversary

The Bill of Rights Institute would like to thank Master Printing + Mailing for their generous print donation of 2025 Wall Calendars! Based in Cleveland, OH, they offer customers a full-service, full-color offset, and digital printing. To learn more about Master Printing + Mailing, visit  https://lnkd.in/dpy44CXQ  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #Printing

Celebrating young civic leaders at the 2024 National Civics Bee! Alaskan middle-schooler Emily Brubaker took home the Bill Daniels National Civics Award and a $100,000 529 plan as the National Civics Bee winner on November 12. Hosted by the U. S. Chamber of Commerce Foundation, the National Civics Bee brings together top middle schoolers from across the country, encouraging them to engage in civics and make a difference. The Bill of Rights Institute partnered closely with the Foundation, creating study guides, contest materials, and event content, while BRIs President David Bobb served as host during the group competition. Read more, here  https://lnkd.in/exegRGAB  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #NationalCivicsBee

At the Bill of Rights Institute, we believe all students deserve access to high-quality civic education. Thats why BRI offers free classroom resources and continually works to expand access for students of all backgrounds. Our Civics for Everyone initiative is made possible by a coalition of partnerstech leaders, corporations, foundations, educational groups, and disability advocateswho share our commitment to helping students learn about our nation, government, and their civic responsibilities. We want to thank the following supporters of the Civics for Everyone initiative: Huddle Up, Scholarship GPS, Periodic Presidents, Donna Vitek from Liberty Tutors, TranslateLive, LSVT Global, Inc., Next Level Speech Therapy, P. C, APP2Speak®, Speak for Yourself, LLC (Heidi LoStracco, MS, CCC-SLP) To learn more, please visit  https://lnkd.in/eX8DHCFP Want to support this initiative? Reach out to Justin Goldstein, CAE.  #BillofRightsInstitute  #BRI  #CivicsforEveryone
